This is the website for the work-in-progress **"GRADE Guidelines Repository in a bookdown"**. This book brings together the GRADE (Grading of Recommendations, Assessment, Development, and Evaluations) guidelines articles, available in the journals in which they have been published over time. 
In addition, you will find links to available resources on the GRADE methodology in english and spanish.

According to the BMJ: *"GRADE is a transparent framework for developing and presenting evidence summaries and provides a systematic approach to making clinical practice recommendations. It is the most widely adopted tool for grading the quality of evidence and for making recommendations, with more than 100 organizations worldwide officially endorsing GRADE."*
